column1: Question: Find all values of $k$ so that the domain of_x000D_
\[b(x) = \frac{kx^2 + 2x - 5}{-5x^2 + 2x + k}\]is the set of all real numbers.
3o-mini: To ensure the domain of b(x) is all real numbers, we must guarantee that the denominator
never equals zero for any real value of x.
A quadratic expression ax² + bx + c is never zero if its discriminant, D = b² – 4ac, is negative.
For the quadratic to have no real roots, we require:
Thus, the domain of b(x) will be all real numbers if and only if k < -1/5.
